data.message: Hey Facebook, a web page is not a piece of paper. There are no space restrictions. Please stop with cutting all the headlines short when my friends post links. An example from today: "Monty Python's John Cleese: ..." Four words? Really? Get a grip, Facebook.

replies.message: Hi Noble. Click-baiting is when a publisher posts a link with a headline that encourages you to click to see more, without telling them much information about what you will see. You can read more about this change at: http://newsroom.fb.com/news/2014/08/news-feed-fyi-click-baiting/ -Chantal

I'm well aware of what click-baiting is. This was not a click-baity headline, but Facebook turned it into one. The full headline was: "Monty Python’s John Cleese: FOX News People Are Too Stupid to Know They Are Stupid (Video)." The publisher provided a fully descriptive headline. Facebook butchered it to the point where it was almost useless.
